cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing (NLP) tasks such as aspect extraction. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques such as Conditional Random Fields (CRF) and lifelong learning, which are commonly used in the field of NLP. 

The paper also involves the use of knowledge retention and transfer, which falls under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the use of CRF for aspect extraction, which is a popular technique in the field of NLP and falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

The paper also involves information retrieval (IR) tasks such as extracting relevant aspects from text, which falls under the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

Finally, the paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques for aspect extraction, which falls under the sub-category of cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) as it involves the use of algorithms and data structures for processing and analyzing text data.
